definition:
Let ${\mathbb{F}}$ be either the real or complex numbers.

Let $p \colon {\mathbb{F}}^n \to {\mathbb{F}}$ be a polynomial in $n$
variables and take integers $d_1, d_2, \ldots, d_n$. The polynomial $p$
is said to be [*weighted homogeneous of degree $k$*]{} if for all
$t > 0$ we have
$$p(t^{d_1} x_1,t^{d_2} x_2,\ldots,t^{d_n} x_n) = t^k p(x_1,x_2,\ldots,x_n) .$$
The $d_1,\ldots,d_n$ are called the [*weights*]{} of the variables
$x_1,\ldots,x_n$.

Note that if $d_1 = d_2 = \ldots = d_n = 1$ then this definition is the
standard homogeneous polynomial.
